problem: How much work is required to stop an electron (m = 9.11×10⁻³¹ kg) which is moving with a speed of 1.40×10⁶ m/s?

correctFormulas.name: Work–energy theorem
correctFormulas.formula: W = ΔK = ½ m v₍f₎² − ½ m vᵢ²

steps.explanation: Stopping the electron removes its initial kinetic energy; the required work is the negative of that energy.
Insert the electron mass and speed.
